intro: Myosotis albosericea, commonly known as the silver-haired forget-me-not, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a silvery underside, giving it its common name. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Myosotis albosericea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its charming appearance.
